text.p: Media company Discovery Communications Inc. said Thursday it has purchased 6.6 percent of children's programming producer Lancit Media Productions Ltd., and may purchase an additional 6.2 percent.
Discovery said it will fully fund the development and production costs of approved and newly developed Lancit programmes, joint projects and promotional spots for Discovery.

Lancit is a New York City-based company known for producing quality, non-violent children's programming. Its "Reading Rainbow" programme won an Emmy award this year for outstanding children's programme.

Discovery said it made an initial $5 million investment in Lancit, acquiring a 6.6 percent stake, representing 438,116 shares valued at $11.41 per share, and warrants to purchase an additional 438,116 shares at $13 per share.
Discovery is a Bethesda, Md.-based media company whose businesses include cable television's Discovery Channel and retailing's The Nature Company.

It is owned by four shareholders -- Liberty Media Corp., a division of Tele-Communications Inc., Cox Communications Inc., Advance/Newhouse Communications and John S. Hendricks, the company's founder and chief executive.
Lancit stock was down 37.5 cents to $11 in afternoon trading on the American Stock Exchange.
